intro: Paeonia lutea, commonly known as the yellow peony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its showy, saucer-shaped flowers that range in color from pale yellow to orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features compound leaves with three to five leaflets. Its roots are fleshy and tuberous, often used in traditional medicine. Paeonia lutea thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
